Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:What does reckless driving lead to on a person? Choices:  A: injuries B: fatigue C: traffic jams D: tired E: accidents<n><n>### Response:		 The best choice is B: fatigue, it shows the effect of reckless driving.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:Where is a ferret getting lots of attention likely to be found? Choices:  A: trouser leg B: sick bay C: own home D: petting zoo E: mother's hair<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Solution:<n>This question has 5 answers and you are asked to choose the one which is correct.<n><n>I found a few strategies from other people on SE answers and stack overflow, I didn’t get any answers but I'll describe here what i've tested :<n>I first picked up answer's' then 'f' because it was not clearly stated in the question, if the answer's' is correct, then 'f' is incorrect too, else it's correct and 'f' is wrong ( the question was too open ended, I could have done the same with a's' ).<n><n>After that i tried answer 'b' but after i got the answer 'a', I realized that it was the same as the previous answers.<n><n>The only answer left was one, i didn't know if the correct answer was in the two or three answers, i used the rule of thirds, because it was easier, so I took answer 'b' and i got the correct answer which I answered that is B :<n><n>1/3 of the choices are 'a', but that's not always true and doesn't work with all questions.<n><n>- Rule 1:<n><n>if any of your choices are wrong or can't be true for this question, don't pick the other answers, it's the choice that we have the least of the three, so I used it first to eliminate the answer that I thought was wrong.<n><n>- Rule of thirds (for choosing from two answers):<n><n>if you can't eliminate any of the choices, pick the first one, if your previous choice is wrong, then you choose the other.<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:Where would a human expect to find manufacturing operations? Choices:  A: factory B: school C: grocery store D: band E: aircraft<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>John only gave a perfunctorily examination of the corped, though he did everything except that was required of him to do the job right. He missed the cause of death for that reason.<n><n>Everyone has some sort of creatiness the best thing to do is ________________ yourself.<n><n>The chair I bought from the factory broke, I need a chair that is not of poor workmanship.<n><n>We build cars at the factory, but human being are not at the factory.<n><n><n>```<n><n>### Input<n>What will the person who makes me coffee tell me the name of his/her boss is?<n><n>### Response<n>```java<n><n>public static void main(String[] args) {<n>    Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);<n>    int choice = sc.nextInt();<n><n><n>    System.out.print("What will the person who made you coffee tell you the name of his/hers boss is?");<n>    System.out<n>   .print("Your choices were:");<n>    System.put.println("A: The Manager");<n>    System.print.println("B: The Foreman");<n>    System.p<n>    rint("C: The Supremo");<n>    System.println("D: The Boss");<n>    System.pr<n>    int.println("E: Your boss");<n><n>    switch (choice) {<n>        case 1:<n>            System.out.println("The Manager");<n><n>      break;<n>        <n>        case 2:<n>            System.printf.println("The Foreman");<n><n>      break<n>        <n>        case -1:<n>            System.put.println("you missed one of them");<n>        <n>        break<n>        <n>        default:<n>            System.printf.println("You chose the wrong answer");<n>        <n>        // If default comes last in the switch or a default code is never encountered, this block executes.<n>    }<n><n>  ```

Choices:  A: pharmacy B: person C: drugstore D: bedroom E: mcdonalds<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>[![Contribute to the open-source community](https://img.shields.io/badge/PRs-welcome-brightgreen.svg?style=flat)](https://makeapullrequest.com)<n>[![GitHub issues](https://img.youtube.com/api/v1/images/youtube;O1XhMjVhbi1BbTxnUu2k7FKXg.jpg?maxwidth=100)](https://github.com/OpenDialog-Project/open-dialog-eng-practice/issues)<n>[![GH Releases](https://img.github.com/badges/release/opendialog/open-dialog-practice.svg)](https://github. com/OpenDialog-Project-/open-dialog- eng-practice/releases)<n><n><a name="how-to-report-bugs"></a><n>## How to report bugs<n><n>Every open bug report will receive a response from an Open Dialog team member!<n><n>First, please click **New Issue**, and answer this [questionnaire](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSckW9pK-b46k4H9qGzJkTZ0yEOI5w0lK5EI2DYlXUe1JCkJ9Q/viewform) to give us more information about the bug.<n><n><a name='how-to-request-a-feature"></a><n>### Making Feature requests<n><n>This section contains all requests for new features, currently implemented as bugs. Only one post is needed, although feel free to edit this post later to add further details. <n><n><span style="color:green; font-weight:bold">**Please make a new post**</span> for each new feature request (this is used as a tracking issue).<n><n><a name="#instructions"></a><n>## Instructions to make your feature request<n><n>The following instructions help to guide the process of making a feature request:<n><n>**Please complete all sections indicated by the asterisks**.<n><n>**Pick the section with the best description of your request to add it to.**<n>1. [Feature Request:

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:James used the cannon to shoot at something while seeking lunch. It was overkill.  What did he shoot at? Choices:  A: body armor B: ungulate C: bomber D: kill people E: animal<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>1 - A 2 - E 3 - C 4 - E<n><n>### Discussion:<n><n>1 - James was looking for game to hunt, so he "overshot" what he was really looking for, a meal. - James shot a cannon into body armor. That could be dangerous, which is why he overshot.<n>2 - James was so thorough in his exploration, he "missed the target" and didn't eat anything. He would've found lunch if he had been a more what? Choices were "careful," "thorough," "complete," and "through." He was through being thorough.<n>3 - All the other options just don't fit anywhere. He shot at animals, who were moving targets. He shot body armor, though that may have been a target, he's a cannon not a bullet.<n>4 - James was a cannon "kinda" shooting body armor. They didn't get into why James was seeking a meal, "killing somebody in war" or "firing at enemy soldiers" would make this sentence more complete.<n>5 - He didn't just shoot at anybody or everything that moved. James was a cannon, not a shotgun, and he fired at body armor not people.<n>6 - If everybody has creativity, what is it for?<n>7 - If it was medium or poor workmanship, the chair wouldn't have fallen apart, it would have just been used for a long time and the wood would have rotted.<n>8 - If the chair was low quality, the wood wouldn't have rotted, it would have just fell apart easily.<n>9 - If cheap, nobody would of bought it, because cheap wood doesn't last long.<n>10 - If people could eat animal flesh and wear fur, that would be poor manners.<n><n><n>### Challenge:<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:Illegitimate designer handbags will not have a certificate of what? Choices:  A: actions B: legal C: authentic D: logical E: legitimate<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>##### Part A<n><n>To be "legal" is to comply with the law. Anything that is legal must also be "right."<n>Therefore, answer: **B - Legal**<n><n>##### Part B<n><n>For "authentic" you can be either "legitimate" or "genuine." You can be legitimate without being genuine, but the opposite is true; you cannot be genuine without being legitimate. Therefore, answer: **A - Genuine** (Note that "true" and "true to their own nature" are not sufficient)<n><n>##### Part C<n><n>Because "illegitimate" bags will not have any such certificate of "actions," answer: **E - Invalid/Unsupported** (Note that the actions will be in compliance with "the law, not moral character" [Note that a "certificate of legal actions" is not needed since it presumes legal actions])<n>

It is a style of artistic expression in music and graphics, which uses as computer equipment, such as a video game console and/or computer. Demoscene software is produced under the rule of artistic quality. The term "scene" implies association and cooperation between artists, but also refers to the group of people who practice their art, even if they are not associated. The demoscene is part of the computer culture, although it uses more limited equipment than ordinary computer users, and it is a computer hacking.<n><n>### Response to Instructions<n>

What the code is doing should be as clear to the user as it is to the programmer.<n><n>### The above code is incorrect because some parts of the program are not clearly explained.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The sentence should read:<n>```<n>Input:A stale smell comes to the kitchen from the space shuttle. He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:What do horses do to get energy? Choices:  A: eat grass B: play C: kept in stables D: dominated E: drink coffee<n><n>### Response:		<n>* A, B, D, E<n>* A, B<n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>### Instructional videos:<n><n>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u-jKo0hkOHE<n><n>https://www2.youtube.com/embed/u-jKo2kfhFE?start=873<n><n>### Multiple Choice Question(s):<n><n>| Question          |	Answer                                         |<n>| :---------------- | :----------------------------------------------- |<n>| What is an adverb? | A word added to a verb, adverb clause, or other adjective to modify its meaning |<n>| What is a pronoun?   | A word that stands in place of a noun or a noun phrase                                        |<n>| What is the difference between a clause and a phrase?         | A phrase is a sequence of related words that does not have a subject-verb relationship. A clause is a phrase that contains a subject-verb relationship  |<n>| What is verbosity?    | A tendency to write or speak excessively.                |<n><n><hr /><n><n>### Instructive Videography:<n><n><iframe  width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube-nocookie.com/embed/RX8FhGFvp9o" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe><n><n>### Explanation of:<n><n>![](https://github.com/BellESS/BellESS_GIT/blob/master/Misc_Files/FamEx_212_R.png)<n><n>### Instantaneous Explanation:<n><n>![](./instant.png)<n><n>#### Reference<n><n>* [Marcus Bell](https://www.linkedin.com/in/bellmarcus/)<n>* [ESS](https://github.co/bellmarcus/ESS)<n><n>

He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:How would someone feel after going for run? Choices:  A: working out B: sore C: get tired D: satisfaction E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: He felt like a dog after a run. He was what? Choices: exhausted, sore, exerted, tired, worn out, sweaty. <n>Answer: Tired<n><n>### Input：<n><n>Input： The people were tired from being exhausted during the whole trip. The bus drove them through a rainstorm.  Who felt tired? Choices:  The passengers The driver The passengers and The driver<n><n>Answer: The passengers<n><n>### Instructions：<n>Write a sentence that correctly explains the relationship between the text and the answer.  Use the same relationship as the sentence that is the response to the task.<n><n>### Input<n>A bus driver had two passengers who slept at night and a passenger who watched porn all night. He turned off the lights at 10pm. He stopped the bus at 12:45 a.m. to pick up a trucker. When he got there at 1 a.m., he found that the passengers awoke, and had been arguing with each other. The two passengers who had slept at night fell asleep again and the driver noticed that the one who had been watching porn fell asleep when he started driving. The trucker had fallen asleep too, but he awoke the driver with something that caused him to go forward and wake the sleeper passenger.<n>When did he find that the passenger who watched porn fell asleep?     Choices: When he had been driving for a little while    When he had been driving about an hour    When he got on the bus<n><n>### Response<n>I was driving for a little while when I finally woke up. I saw the sleeper passenger in the back of the bus lying next to the seat. The passenger had been watching the movie and turned off the light.<n><n>### Task Description:<n>### Demonstraion<n>How would you describe the sentence?<n>Input:The passenger had been watching the move and turned off the light<n><n>### Response description:<n>Input:I was watching the movie and turned out the light. <n><n><n><n>

People liked her because she was what? Choices:  A: excellent B: fun C: honest D: worthy E: choice<n><n>### Response:		Mary told everyone that the best way to be a bad girl was to be open about it. He looked like a friend until he was introduced and when he was told what to do, he ran out and was gone.<n><n>### Response.<n>John knew that all the stories he had been told by his friend about the house being haunted were true. When he investigated later, he found that the person he met was a murderer who had just escaped from jail.<n><n>### Output<n>The person said "yes, it is my house. I live here.". The guy's reaction was a result of knowing his best friend's true identity. John also responded by running out.<n><n>### Challenge:<n>The story of the haunted house is well known and the guy has heard it many times. But the reaction of the guy to the question, "Hi, do you live here too?" was because of that.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>Input: Everybody has some sort of creativity, it's the best way to what? Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:What is a convenient place for a bus station? Choices:  A: maps B: street C: catch bus D: city centre E: school<n><n>### Response:		A: maps<n><n>### Output:<n>What is a useful quality in a friend for a new house? Choices:  R: responsible B: dependable C: considerate D: reliable E: faithful<n><n>### Response (for R):<n>D: reliable<n><n><n>### Condemnation:<n>The judge gave him a light sentence, noting that he had no prior crime record.  He was lenient on him because what? Choices: A: he had been an innocent victim. B: he was only doing the minimum. C: he was well connected. D: he had confessed. E: he had been treated badly by his parents.<n><n>### Response(for C):<n>B: he was only doing what<n><n>### Rationale:<n>### A: he had been a innocent victim.  No wrong had been done to him, so why should he not be compensated with a light sentence?<n>### B: he was only onfessing.  Convicted prisoners rarely admit to their own guilt.  It's the job of the judge only to sentence the criminal, not to try him.<n>### C: he was doing what he was only doing the what he had been sentenced for and that was to the minimum.  The judge therefore had no basis for reducing his sentence on any grounds.<n>### D: he had been treated better than his parents.  Though he had been wronged by his parents, he had not been a criminal.<n>### E: he had been a well connected.  Though he had connections that allowed him to live a life of luxury and even the respect of those who were not well connected, he did not deserve the leniency.  He was therefore to spend a good amount of time in prison.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>### A,B,C,D,E were not possible choices.  <n>Only C was a suitable choice.<n>

Choices: A: green B: leafy C: dried D: fleshy E: dead F: hardy<n><n>### Response1:A cactus is a succulent, so it is a fleshy type of plant.<n><n>### Response2:<n><n>### Input2:What's a common food that helps to keep one's blood sugar in check? Choices: 1 B 2 A 3 D 4 E<n><n>### Response 2:<n>Fresh fruit and vegetables are important for keeping one's blood sugar levels level.<n><n>### A sentence in the context could be something like: "The bubbly water, crispy salad, and tasty bread all made the meal complete." A completed sentence is a sentence that is...<n><n>### Completed: in it's entirety.<n><n>### There are other things that you might say in response to someone else's input besides merely agreeing.<n><n>### Other Responses:You could ask questions to clarify information. You could comment on someone's choice of example.<n><n>### <n>1. Ask questions to clarify information.<n>1. Comment on someone's choice or type of example.<n><n><n>### Input Example: This sentence could be used in a context: "How did you hurt your back?" Someone gave me a terrible push.<n><n>### Contextual Example 2: She got into a bad scuffle with a few of the bar's bouncers. This contextual sentence could describe a bad scuffle in many ways: Choices:  A. She was pushed.  B. She got punched.  C. She got pulled.  D. She was tripped.  E. She tripped herself.  F. She got pushed onto the floor.  G. Someone hit her with a bottle.<n><n><n>## Input Example:She's on a diet.

Choices:  A: create art B: write C: sew D: create idea E: express yourself<n>Answer: E: express yourself<n><n>Input: He expected high quality for the money he spent, but the chair fell apart from what? Choices:  A: bad taste B: crummy C: cheap D: medium E: poor workmanship<n>Answer: E: poor workmanship<n><n>### Input:Along what feature will you find a rosebush? Choices:  A: park B: in the ground C: hedgerow D: temperate climate E: botanical gardens<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input;<n>I will be on time because I'm what? Choices: A: precise B: exact C: on time<n>Answer: C: on time<n><n>### Response<n><n>I will be on tine because of I'm what?<n><n>### Input<n><n>A: He said what was wrong.  B: She was what? Choices: C: untruthful D: kindness E: sincere F: inscrutable<n>Answer: D: kindness<n><n>### Response;B<n><n>A: He admitted what was wrong. B: He was kind. C: He was what? D: He had been kind. E: He showed kindness. F: We became what? Answer: A: He was candid<n><n>### Input A: He was what? B: The teacher was what? Choices C: gentle D: kind E: loving F: strict G: cruel<n>Answer: C: gentle <n><n>### Response A: The teacher was gentle. B: You were kind.<n><n>Input A B A: He was what because he was what? B: He would be what in the future in order to be what to us now? <n>Answer: A: kind B: He would be kind in the future in order that he could be kind to us now.<n><n>### Input Choices 1. He was on time. 2. He was prepared. 3. He was organized. 4. He was precise.<n><n>### Response Choices 1. I will be on time Choices 2. You should be prepared. Choices 3. You should be organized. Choices 4. I know what you're saying. Choices 5. We could what?<n><n>## Example 4<n>Input: I always have a ready answer for that man. He always asks what? Choices: E: if I was an only child. <n>Answer: E: if I were an only child<n><n>Input: I always keep a pocketknife handy to cut the tag off. I would have cut it off with what? Choices: D: the pencil, or D: pencil stub <n>Answer: D: the penncil stub<n><n>Input: I wish they'd have left her on earth a few hours longer so I could have said what to her?
